sentences: Pangodi järv meenutab paljus oma suuremat sõsarat Pühajärve.
Peale lühikese varrega metsmaasika, meie lemmiku, kasvab peamiselt parkides ta pikavarreline sõsar – kõrge maasikas.
Vanem, noorem sõsar. Märt hoidis väga oma väikest sõsarat.
context: The word 'sarnast' appears to be a typo or misrepresentation in the given input. Based on the dictionary definitions provided, the correct Estonian word is 'sõsar', which means sister. It can refer to: 1) A female sibling (older/younger sister), used in expressions like 'Märt hoidis väga oma väikest sõsarat' (Märt protected his little sister very much). 2) A close woman companion or relative, as in the poetic context about being sisters and brothers for those who suffer. 3) Figuratively, it can refer to something similar or related of the same kind, like a lake that resembles its 'sister' lake (Pangodi Lake reminds one of its bigger sister Pühajärv), or plants of the same species.
